attributes.action: Debate why banks are not opening business current accounts for new companies
attributes.additional_details: Nearly 700,000 new companies get formed every year. During the Covid-19 pandemic, preventing new companies from starting operations is extremely harmful to the UK economy. Without business current accounts, new companies can not get going. Innovation is part of the solution (Starling Bank, MachFast, Monzo, Revolut, Tide) but traditional banks should be open for new business as well.
attributes.background: At the moment, banks are not opening business current accounts for new businesses.  https://www.bbc.com/news/business-54463211; https://smallbusiness.co.uk/most-banks-not-allowing-small-businesses-to-open-bank-accounts-2551370/; https://machfast.com/how-do-i-open-a-business-current-account/

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for individual banks.
